titleStmt.title: The XXIII Parliament of our most high and dread soueraine Iames by the grace of God, King of Scotland, England, France, and Ireland: defender of the faith; &c. Halden at Edinburgh, the 4. day of August 1621. by the noble and potent lord James Marquis of Hamilton ... Extracted foorth of the registers and the bookes of the Acts of Parliament of this kingdome of Scotland, by Sir George Hay, of Kinfawns, Knight: clerke of his Maiesties Counsell, register, and rolles.
Laws, etc.
titleStmt.author: Scotland.
Hay, John, Sir, 1578-1654.

titleStmt.title: The XXIII Parliament of our most high and dread soueraine Iames by the grace of God, King of Scotland, England, France, and Ireland: defender of the faith; &c. Halden at Edinburgh, the 4. day of August 1621. by the noble and potent lord James Marquis of Hamilton ... Extracted foorth of the registers and the bookes of the Acts of Parliament of this kingdome of Scotland, by Sir George Hay, of Kinfawns, Knight: clerke of his Maiesties Counsell, register, and rolles.
Laws, etc.

Hay, John, Sir, 1578-1654.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Finlason, His Maiesties printer,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: King Iames the Sext. XXIII Parliament the 4 day of August, 1621.
In this edition the title has "James by"; last page ends: The end of the XXiij. ..
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
